title: DarkComet
descrption: DarkComet is a Windows remote administration tool and backdoor.[1][2]

references.title: Kujawa, A. (2018, March 27). You dirty RAT! Part 1: DarkComet. Retrieved November 6, 2018.
Unit42. (2016). SILVERTERRIER: THE RISE OF NIGERIAN BUSINESS EMAIL COMPROMISE. Retrieved November 13, 2018.
FireEye. (2018, October 03). APT38: Un-usual Suspects. Retrieved November 6, 2018.

related.Name: Audio Capture
related.Use: DarkComet can listen in to victims' conversations through the system’s microphone.[1][2]

related.Name: Clipboard Data
related.Use: DarkComet can steal data from the clipboard.[2]

related.Name: Command-Line Interface
related.Use: DarkComet can launch a remote shell to execute commands on the victim’s machine.[2]

related.Name: Disabling Security Tools
related.Use: DarkComet can disable Security Center functions like anti-virus and the Windows Firewall.[1][2]

related.Name: Masquerading
related.Use: DarkComet has dropped itself onto victim machines with file names such as WinDefender.Exe and winupdate.exe in an apparent attempt to masquerade as legitimate.[1]

related.Name: Modify Registry
related.Use: DarkComet adds a Registry value for its installation routine to the Registry Key HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System Enable LUA="0" and HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\DC3_FEXEC.[1][2]

related.Name: Process Discovery
related.Use: DarkComet can list active processes running on the victim’s machine.[2]

related.Name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
related.Use: DarkComet adds several Registry entries to enable automatic execution at every system startup.[1][2]

related.Name: Remote Desktop Protocol
related.Use: DarkComet can open an active screen of the victim’s machine and take control of the mouse and keyboard.[2]

related.Name: Remote File Copy
related.Use: DarkComet can load any files onto the infected machine to execute.[1][2]

related.Name: Scripting
related.Use: DarkComet can execute various types of scripts on the victim’s machine.[2]

related.Name: Software Packing
related.Use: DarkComet has the option to compress its payload using UPX or MPRESS.[2]

related.Name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
related.Use: DarkComet can use HTTP for C2 communications.[2]

related.Name: System Information Discovery
related.Use: DarkComet can collect the computer name, RAM used, and operating system version from the victim’s machine.[1][2]

related.Name: System Owner/User Discovery
related.Use: DarkComet gathers the username from the victim’s machine.[1]

related.Name: Video Capture
related.Use: DarkComet can access the victim’s webcam to take pictures.[1][2]
